intro: Chrysanthemum dugourii subsp. erythrocarpon, commonly known as the red-fruited chrysanthemum, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive red or orange berries, which contrast with its green foliage and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical features include narrow, lance-shaped leaves and a compact growth habit. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
